intro: Mentzelia scabra subsp. scabra, commonly known as rough mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky slopes and sandy soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Mentzelia scabra subsp. scabra is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient conditions.
